text: Thiol modulation inhibits the interleukin ( IL ) - 1-mediated activation of an <extra_id_0> IL-1 receptor <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - associated protein kinase and NF-kappa B .

The <extra_id_0> interleukin-1 receptor type I <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-1RI <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) is associated with other proteins thus forming a complex system by which IL-1 exerts its various signals .

The initiating event is still uncertain , but activation of a recently described receptor - associated protein kinase is one of the earliest events detectable ( Martin et al . , Eur.J.Immunol.1994.24 : 1566 ) .
IL-1 signaling is commonly accompanied by oxidative processes and is thought to be subject to redox regulation .

We therefore investigated whether the activation of the <extra_id_0> IL-1RI <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - associated protein kinase could be a target for redox regulation and whether an altered activity of the kinase could influence IL-1 - mediated NF-kappa B activation .
A murine T cell line , EL4 , was stimulated with IL-1 with and without pretreatment with different compounds known to influence the cellular redox status .

Thiol modifying agents like diamide , menadione , pyrrolidine dithiocarbamate ( PDTC ) , diethyl dithiocarbamate or phenylarsine oxide inhibited the IL-1 - induced activation of the <extra_id_0> IL-1RI <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - associated protein kinase .
N - Acetylcysteine , alpha , alpha'-dipyridyl , aminotriazole or nitrofurantoin did not show any effect .
The inhibition by PDTC was reversible unless glutathione synthesis was blocked by buthionine sulfoximine .

The described conditions which inhibited or prevented the activation of the <extra_id_0> IL-1RI <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - associated kinase similarly impaired the activation of NF-kappa B in EL4 cells .

From these observations we conclude that free thiols in the <extra_id_0> IL-1RI <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> complex are essential for the activation of the <extra_id_0> IL-1RI <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - associated protein kinase and that this process is mandatory for IL-1 signaling leading to NF-kappa B activation .
